Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of battle scene: forelegs of rearing horse, to right, with probably rider's spear pointing down; lower body and advanced right leg of Amazon, to left, wearing knee-length patterned garment, belted at waist with five added white dots on belt and band at bottom of tunic skirt decorated with wave pattern; patterned legging; at the bottom of the sherd are two horizontal pole-like objects in white, bisected lenthwise by dilute brown line with dots, passing in front of the spear, the Amazon's foot and the horse's hoof.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0240) (Phase 1)
